accessibilityRules.Description: Element has redundant text and content-desc/label. Screen readers might announce it twice.
Interactive element has a touch target size smaller than the recommended minimum (e.g., 48x48px).
Editable text field lacks an accessible label/description.
Informational element (like a TextView/StaticText) is marked as interactive but lacks a clear accessible role or descriptive name/label.
Checkbox/Radio button/Switch is missing 'checked' or 'selected' state attribute.
Interactive element is marked as disabled but may still be reachable or announced incorrectly.
Element is completely off-screen and inaccessible.

accessibilityRules.Description: Element has 'importantForAccessibility="no"' (Android specific) but contains interactive or meaningful content that might be hidden from assistive technologies.
Password field's visible text or accessible label might expose sensitive information or be too generic. It should typically be obscured.
accessibilityRules.Tags: security, forms, mobile, wcag2a, wcag2aa, EN_301_549

accessibilityRules.Description: Element's accessible label consists only of special characters. This is not descriptive for screen readers.
Editable field's label suggests a specific input type (e.g., email, phone) but has a generic input type attribute. Consider using a more specific type.
Interactive element's accessible label does not contain its visible text. This can be confusing for screen reader users.
